channel.title: Help for a good cause
channel.description:
Trent’s aka “Surbo” stepbrother Robert M. Sacks recently had a devastating loss. Robert’s wife Lee Anne Archer Sacks died of breast cancer this past May of 2007. To honor the memory of his wife, Robert will be riding his bike 100 miles Portland, OR - September 29-30, 2007 in the Livestrong Challenge and try to raise at least $5000 for the Lance Armstrong Foundation which was founded in 1997 by cancer survivor and champion cyclist, Lance Armstrong, to inspire and empower people affected by cancer. livestrongchallenge.org. Robert is riding for her memory and the hope that the funds that he helps raise for research might preclude others from having to experience his deep loss. Robert knows he can do this with the support and help of family, friends, and friends of friends…like you. Would you please consider making a donation? Follow this link to visit his personal web page and helps him in his efforts to support Lance Armstrong Foundation. You can donate online at: [url=http://portland07.livestrong.org/faf/r.asp?t=4&i=219861&u=219861-178732939&e=1109899200]LINK[/url] Thank you in advance for your time and generosity. Trent’s Mom In an attempt to gain support for this cause, anyone who donates to the cause (no matter how large or small) will receive an account at i-hacked. Just email me and let me know that you have donated. Thanks -Bill (hevnsnt) EDIT: In another attempt to gain support for this great cause, anyone who donates will receive free hosting from CodedChaos Hosting, please email me and let me know you have donated and I will give you a hosting account. Thanks -CodedChaos
http://edge.i-hacked.com/help-for-a-good-cause I'm going to donate as soon as I get my paypal account, so if you have even a few cents you don't need please consider donating because it's a great cause. EDIT:Also if this isn't okay for me to post just lock/delete although I don't think the staff will mind :)

item.title: Help for a good cause
item.dc:creator: @slooshismyname slooshismyname
item.description:
@slooshismyname wrote:

I would if I had money to spare.

That guy deserves more than 5 thousand though, he lost his wife and he’s riding 100 miles, he’s got a heart. I’ll respect him.

Read full topic

item.title: Help for a good cause
item.dc:creator: @nohope nohope
item.description:
@nohope wrote:

I dont have any money to donate… sorry… I dont have any money at all… and 100 miles of bike riding deserves5million not 5thousand… thank you for posting this.

Read full topic

item.title: Help for a good cause
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Trent’s aka “Surbo” stepbrother Robert M. Sacks recently had a devastating loss. Robert’s wife Lee Anne Archer Sacks died of breast cancer this past May of 2007. To honor the memory of his wife, Robert will be riding his bike 100 miles Portland, OR - September 29-30, 2007 in the Livestrong Challenge and try to raise at least $5000 for the Lance Armstrong Foundation which was founded in 1997 by cancer survivor and champion cyclist, Lance Armstrong, to inspire and empower people affected by cancer. livestrongchallenge.org. Robert is riding for her memory and the hope that the funds that he helps raise for research might preclude others from having to experience his deep loss.

Robert knows he can do this with the support and help of family, friends, and friends of friends…like you. Would you please consider making a donation? Follow this link to visit his personal web page and helps him in his efforts to support Lance Armstrong Foundation. You can donate online at:
LINK

Thank you in advance for your time and generosity.

Trent’s Mom

In an attempt to gain support for this cause, anyone who donates to the cause (no matter how large or small) will receive an account at i-hacked. Just email me and let me know that you have donated.

Thanks
-Bill (hevnsnt)

EDIT:
In another attempt to gain support for this great cause, anyone who donates will receive free hosting from CodedChaos Hosting, please email me and let me know you have donated and I will give you a hosting account.

Thanks
-CodedChaos

I’m going to donate as soon as I get my paypal account, so if you have even a few cents you don’t need please consider donating because it’s a great cause.
